briefdescription.para: Get the anchor point on bodyA in world coordinates.
Get the anchor point on bodyB in world coordinates.
Get the current joint angle in radians.
Get the current joint angle speed in radians per second.
Get the lower joint limit in radians.
Get the upper joint limit in radians.
Set the joint limits in radians.
Set the motor speed in radians per second.
Get the motor speed in radians per second.
Set the maximum motor torque, usually in N-m.

detaileddescription.para: Get the reaction force given the inverse time step. Unit is N.
Get the reaction torque due to the joint limit given the inverse time step. Unit is N*m.
Get the current motor torque given the inverse time step. Unit is N*m.

A revolute joint constrains two bodies to share a common point while they are free to rotate about the point. The relative rotation about the shared point is the joint angle. You can limit the relative rotation with a joint limit that specifies a lower and upper angle. You can use a motor to drive the relative rotation about the shared point. A maximum motor torque is provided so that infinite forces are not generated.
